dataset.title: POD! Fish- DFG Summer Townet Survey Juvenile fish sampling 1959-2006

creator.organizationName: NCEAS 12192: Fleishman: Ecosystem analysis of pelagic organism declines in the Upper San Francisco Estuary
National Center for Ecological Analysis and Synthesis
California Department of Fish and Game (DFG)

abstract.para: Since 1959, this survey has developed indices for the abundance of young striped bass when the average size is 38 mm by sampling 31 stations from San Pablo Bay through the Delta. The original purpose was to predict recruitment to the adult stock but the index has proven valuable in gauging the environmental health of the estuary. Young striped bass abundance is primarily a function of Delta outflow, Delta water exports and egg production. Abundance indices for other species have also revealed important trends. For example, the index for delta smelt was useful in determining its status as a threatened species. This survey is mandated by the 1995 USFWS Biological Opinion (BO) for delta smelt on the operation of the SWP and CVP.

contact.organizationName: California Department of Fish and Game (DFG)

dataTable.entityName: DFG Summer Townet Survey 1959-2006 Catch Matrices by Tow.csv

physical.objectName: DFG Summer Townet Survey 1959-2006 Catch Matrices by Tow.csv

attribute.attributeDefinition: Year
Gives the survey number for that year (1-6).

textDomain.definition: Gives the survey number for that year (1-6).

attribute.attributeDefinition: Date (month, day, year format) that the data was collected in the field.
Represents the physical location of the individual sampling site, specific to Townet Survey.
Active station
Townet survey tows a minimum of two tows, but will tow three times if fish are captured on either of the first two tows.

textDomain.definition: Townet survey tows a minimum of two tows, but will tow three times if fish are captured on either of the first two tows.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Difference in minutes between the start time (when net is set) and the end time (when the net frame reaches the boat).
Secchi disk diameter In centimeters.
Measured using YSI equipment and corrected to 25 degrees Celsius.
Measured (using YSI equipment) at the lowest depth at the site and corrected to 25 degrees Celsius.
Index from 1-4, 1=high slack, 2=ebb, 3=low slack, 4=flood.
In feet
Temperature in degrees Celsius at the top of the water column.
A constant (~735 cubic meters or the average filtrate of the townet) used to calculate the CPUE for the TNS, since flowmeters were not used (per tow) until 2003.
CPUE Townet Calculation: Is equal to the catch per tow divided by the constant (735 cubic meters) and then multiplied by 10000, a scaling factor.
